intro: Gymnocalycium horstii subsp. horstii, commonly known as the Horstii cactus, is a species native to Argentina. It is a compact, spiny cactus with a globular shape and typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its areoles are covered with white, dense hair. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
